column4: To install your newly created package (which should be in whatever directory you were in when you ran apt-get --build source), run 'dpkg -i wine*.deb' as root.
I dont get that part...
Install Wine
did you download a wine deb package?
open a terminal and type 'winecfg'
do you consider yourself technologically proficient?
have you ever been in /etc/apt/sources.list?
type 'nano' at the command line and see if you can make sense of the commands...if so, I'll fix you up
the caret is the 'control' button
does it make sense to you?
if so, get out of it, punch in 'sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list' and remove the # from the lines that say 'universe'
then save and exit, type 'sudo aptitude update'
then 'sudo aptitude install wine'
and after that go back in there and add the # back
is Writeout the same as Save?
yes
I got this in the terminal after it was updating or whatever:
it's okay, you can proceed with that host
repo's or 'repositories' are encrypted with GPG keys to be safe.  If you added it on purpose, you can assume you know what you're doing
use a capital Y to accept
still there?
